title: Migrating from Hyper 0.14 to Hyper 1.7
body:
- Upgraded several dependencies, including `hyper`, `routerify`, and `regex`, to their latest versions for improved performance and security.
- Refactored request handling to utilize `http_body_util` for better body management, transitioning from `Body` to `Full<Bytes>` in various places.
- Updated middleware functions to accommodate changes in request and response types.
- Adjusted tests to reflect the new request handling and dependency updates, ensuring compatibility with the latest changes.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Improved error responses and status mapping; more reliable static-file ETag/304 handling.

* **Updates**
  * Migrated HTTP body handling to a full-body model and upgraded core routing/HTTP libraries for stability and compatibility.
  * WebSocket middleware adapted to the new body model.
  * Dependency updates including an HTTP library upgrade.

* **Tests**
  * Tests updated to the new body/routing model; several streaming tests simplified or deferred.

* **Chores**
  * Test script timing/process handling and project ignore entries adjusted.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Feat/errors
body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

## Release Notes

* **Bug Fixes**

* **Documentation**

* **Tests**

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Implement router mounting functionality in `App` for modular route or…
body:
…ganization

- Added a new `router` method to the `App` struct, allowing users to mount a `Router` at a specified base path.
- Updated the `Router` struct to make `base_path` public within the crate.
- Deprecated the previous `register` method in `Router`, encouraging the use of `app.router` instead.
- Adjusted tests to reflect the new router integration method.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * App-level router mounting for centralized mounting with automatic base-path handling and route registration

* **Deprecations**
  * Router-level registration method deprecated (since v1.9.12); migrate to the new app-level mounting approach

* **Tests**
  * Tests updated to exercise the new app-level router registration flow

* **Documentation**
  * Examples and docs updated to demonstrate the new mounting workflow
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Refactor handler cloning in API route setup and simplify parameter ha…
body:
…ndling in HttpRequest

- Updated the handler cloning mechanism to use `Arc::clone` for better memory management in the API route setup.
- Simplified parameter handling in `HttpRequest` by initializing `RouteParams` directly, removing unnecessary code for extracting parameters from request data.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Behavior
  - Request handling now includes query and route parameters earlier, improving middleware and routing consistency.

- Refactor
  - Simplified request/response flow and route-parameter initialization for clearer, more maintainable server behavior.

- Performance
  - Improved handler ownership/invocation to reduce routing overhead.

- Style
  - Minor formatting cleanups for consistency.

- Documentation
  - WebSocket example updated: on-close callback signature simplified.

- Tests
  - Two middleware execution tests are now ignored (skipped) in the test run.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Update documentation examples across multiple modules to improve clar…
body:
…ity and consistency

- Changed code block annotations from `no_run,ignore` to `no_run` in various examples to prevent execution during tests.
- Enhanced example clarity by ensuring proper usage of imports and structuring for `HttpRequest`, `HttpResponse`, and middleware examples.
- Removed outdated example sections in `RequestBody` documentation to streamline content and focus on relevant usage patterns.
- Overall improvements aim to facilitate better understanding and usability of the Ripress framework's documentation.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Improved request body handling: automatic parsing for JSON, URL-encoded forms, multipart forms (preserves text fields when files are uploaded), plus better text vs. binary detection and support for +json/+xml content types.
  * More accurate content-type classification for incoming requests.

* **Documentation**
  * Updated and simplified examples across modules; revised HttpRequest/HttpResponse usage examples and removed large inline samples.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Add error handling improvements across request modules
body:
Refactor error handling in `query_params`, `route_params`, `text_data`, and `body` modules to utilize a unified `RipressError` type. Update related methods to return `RipressError` instead of specific error enums, enhancing consistency in error reporting. Introduce a new `error` module for better organization of error types. Update tests to reflect these changes and ensure proper error handling in various scenarios.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added a unified, user-facing error type with categories (IO, Parse, Invalid Input, Not Found) and readable messages; exported at crate root.

* **Refactor**
  * Query params, route params, and text body APIs now return the unified error; legacy per-feature errors made crate-private and removed from public exports and re-exports.
  * Text body functions updated to propagate the unified error.

* **Documentation**
  * Examples and docs updated for the unified error surface.

* **Tests**
  * Tests updated to assert the new error type and kinds.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Add box_future and box_future_middleware functions to helpers

Introduce two new utility functions, box_future and box_future_middleware, to the helpers module for easier handling of futures in middleware. Update relevant imports in types and app modules to utilize these new functions, enhancing code organization and readability.

  - No user-facing behavior changes.

- Tests

title: Enhance middleware support by introducing pre and post middleware exe…
body:
…cution in Ripress. Updated documentation and examples to reflect new middleware types, execution order, and added comprehensive tests. Updated `set_cookie` method to accept optional cookie configuration. Updated CHANGELOG for upcoming release.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Distinct pre- and post-middleware with defined execution order (pre → route → post).
  * Dedicated setup methods for CORS, logging, security, and compression; built-ins now include compression.

* **Breaking Changes**
  * Middleware registration renamed to use_pre_middleware; use_post_middleware added (old single registration deprecated).
  * Cookie setter accepts optional options; defaults applied when omitted.

* **Documentation**
  * Guides, API reference, examples, and changelog updated for pre/post middleware and execution flow.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

- Updated server port from 8080 to 3000 to align with new configurations.
- Modified test configurations and request tests to reflect the new server port.
- Adjusted TypeScript configuration to include DOM library for improved compatibility.

  - Updated test configuration to target the new port and include DOM typings; added global test typings for WebSocket state.

title: Implement AsyncRead and AsyncWrite for HttpRequest to handle various …
body:
…content types

- Enhanced the poll_write method to support appending binary, text, JSON, and form data content.
- Updated the poll_read method to read from the request body and handle different content types appropriately.
- Added logic to manage content type transitions when reading and writing data.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Added optional async streaming support for HTTP request bodies (opt-in feature).
  - Enables incremental reading and writing of request payloads across text, JSON, form, and binary formats while preserving content type.
  - Supports mixed binary-with-fields payloads, maintaining associated form data during updates.
  - Improves resilience to non-UTF-8 data by gracefully falling back to binary representation.
  - Flush and shutdown operations are now no-ops for these async streams, reducing overhead.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Refactor file upload middleware to use FileUploadConfiguration struct
body:
- Updated the file_upload function to accept an optional FileUploadConfiguration instead of a string for the upload directory.
- Introduced FileUploadConfiguration struct with fields for upload directory, max file size, max files, and allowed file types, along with a default implementation.
- Enhanced documentation examples to reflect the new configuration structure.
- Added validation for max file size and allowed file types during file uploads.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Config-driven file upload middleware: multipart & binary uploads, per-file/request limits, allowed types, automatic filenames; accepts a configuration object.
  - Built-in CORS behavior: reflective vs static header modes, credential handling, and proper preflight handling.
  - Built-in rate limiter and logger middlewares with configurable behavior and headers.

- Documentation
  - Expanded docs and examples for CORS, logger, rate limiter, and file upload configuration.

- Tests
  - Updated tests to use the new file upload configuration object.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

- Updated the handling of form fields to ensure that the generated filenames are correctly associated with their respective field names.
- Cleaned up commented-out code in the request tests to enable multipart form data tests, ensuring better coverage for file upload scenarios.

  * Preserved mapping of uploaded files to their corresponding form fields for accurate request handling.

* **Tests**

title: Update dependencies, enhance middleware, and improve tests
body:
- Added new dependencies: `autocfg`, `bitflags`, `memoffset`, and `nix` to support additional features.
- Refactored `path_matches` function for improved path matching logic.
- Updated `ResponseContentBody`, `Cookie`, and `CookieOptions` structs to derive `PartialEq` for better comparison.
- Introduced comprehensive tests for CORS middleware and enhanced existing tests for request and response handling.
- Added new tests for binary response handling and HTTP methods.
- Improved router functionality with additional route methods for OPTIONS, PATCH, DELETE, POST, and HEAD.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Native support for binary request bodies (application/octet-stream).
  - Direct access to request-scoped data on incoming requests.
  - New public error type for richer error handling.

- **Improvements**
  - More flexible route prefix matching for root and trailing slashes.
  - Equality (PartialEq) added for cookies, cookie options, response headers, route params, and internal body variants.

- **Tests**
  - Extensive new and reorganized test coverage across routing, CORS, logger, request/response bodies, headers, query/route params, methods, and status codes.

- **Chores**
  - Updated development dependencies.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Feat/file uploads
body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Multi-file multipart/form-data uploads: extracts all file parts and text fields, saves files with inferred extensions and unique names, records per-file metadata, and preserves single-file binary upload behavior with backward-compatible keys.
  * New request API to insert form fields programmatically and improved body parsing (better JSON/form/multipart handling).

* **Documentation**
  * Expanded feature catalog, updated file-upload guides, examples, and tutorials to reflect multi-file behavior, request data keys (uploaded_file_count, uploaded_files, original_filename) and form-field mapping.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Update dependencies and enhance middleware documentation
body:
- Added new dependencies: `uuid` and `infer` for improved functionality.
- Updated `tokio` features to include `fs` and `io-util` for enhanced I/O capabilities.
- Introduced a new `file_upload` middleware module to handle file uploads, with accompanying documentation for clarity.
- Refactored `HttpRequest` struct to include `Debug` trait for better logging and debugging.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Added a file upload middleware that accepts binary uploads, saves files with unique names to a configurable directory, and infers file types.

- **Documentation**
  - Added comprehensive middleware docs, examples, README and guides showing how to mount and use the file-upload middleware.

- **Refactor**
  - HttpRequest now derives Debug and middleware data is stored/consumed via a typed extension approach.

- **Chores**
  - Expanded async runtime features and added UUID and file-type detection dependencies.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Add binary response handling and related tests
body:
- Introduced a new endpoint `/binary-test` to handle binary data responses.
- Updated `ResponseContentBody` and `RequestBody` to support binary content types.
- Enhanced `HttpRequest` and `HttpResponse` implementations to manage binary data.
- Added tests for binary response functionality to ensure correct behavior and content type handling.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Support for binary request and response bodies (application/octet-stream).
  * Public API to read raw request bytes and to send binary responses.
  * Unknown or invalid MIME types now default to binary handling.
  * Added a test endpoint that returns a fixed binary payload.

* **Tests**
  * Enabled binary response test and added binary test route.
  * Updated text body test to include an explicit Content-Type header.

* **Documentation**
  * Expanded docs and examples for creating and handling binary payloads.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Change visibility of `exec_middleware` and `ApiError` enum to crate s…
body:
…cope

- Updated `exec_middleware` function to be accessible only within the crate by changing its visibility from public to `pub(crate)`.
- Modified `ApiError` enum to also have crate-level visibility, enhancing encapsulation and control over error handling within the module.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- Refactor
  - Restricted internal error type visibility to the crate for better encapsulation; no behavioral changes.
  - Limited middleware execution helper visibility to the crate; no impact on runtime behavior.

- Notes
  - No user-facing changes. Potentially impacts external integrations relying on previously public internals.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Feat/docs
body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Added middleware support with path scoping, ordered execution, request/response mutation, and optional short-circuiting.
  - Introduced a public, high-performance byte-oriented request data container with UTF-8-aware keys, memory utilities, and convenient iteration.

- **Documentation**
  - New guides for request body handling (JSON, form, text, empty), content-type and UTF-8 behavior.
  - New guide for the byte-oriented request data store with examples, performance notes, and best practices.

- **Refactor**
  - Internal reorganization of the request data module; API surface preserved where applicable.

- **Chores**
  - Removed outdated blog example application.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Feat/docs
body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Added tutorials: Routing Basics and Your First App.
  - URL type now supports serialization and provides as_str/value accessors.
  - Param errors are now serializable.

- Refactor
  - Renamed request field from query_params to query (breaking).
  - Renamed helper to get_all_query (breaking).
  - Removed macro for bulk route parameter extraction (breaking).
  - Improved origin URL derivation and internal method mapping.

- Documentation
  - Updated all query parameter examples to use req.query.
  - Removed Basic Routing example; revised route params guide.
  - Updated imports and examples across guides.

- Tests
  - Adjusted tests and scripts to the new query field.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Refactor request body handling and enhance documentation
body:
- Improved the `RequestBody` struct to provide a clearer representation of supported body types, including JSON, form data, and text.
- Added detailed documentation for `RequestBody`, `RequestBodyType`, and `RequestBodyContent` to clarify usage and examples.
- Introduced new methods for creating request bodies with JSON and form data, ensuring type safety and consistency.
- Enhanced `TextData` with additional methods for handling UTF-8 validation and character limits.
- Updated `QueryParamError` documentation to provide better context for error handling.
- Refactored `get` method in `RequestData` for improved readability.
- Adjusted tests to reflect changes in request handling and ensure functionality remains intact.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Typed HTTP request body (JSON, Text, Form) with automatic content-type mapping and easy constructors.
  - Flexible TextData type: UTF-8 validation, lossy options, size limits, safe truncation, and ergonomic conversions.
  - FormData parsing from comma-separated (and ampersand-fallback) query strings with URL decoding and whitespace trimming.

- **Documentation**
  - Expanded and clarified query-params and error docs.

- **Refactor**
  - Minor internal formatting cleanup; no behavior changes.

- **Tests**
  - Simplified request bindings in middleware tests; no behavior changes.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Remove `body.rs` file and refactor request body handling. Updated `Ht…
body:
…tpRequest` to utilize `TextData` for text content management, enhancing type safety and consistency. Adjusted related tests to reflect these changes.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - TextData: robust text body type with UTF‑8 validation, charset support, size limits, safe truncation, and serialization.
  - Enhanced FormData: rich key/value handling, iteration, and query-string parsing/serialization.
  - Request bodies explicitly support JSON, text, and form content types with proper MIME mapping.

- **Refactor**
  - Text handling now uses TextData; text accessors return string slices.

- **Tests**
  - Added and updated tests to validate TextData and updated request/response flows.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Fix/refactor
body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added a typed RequestBody abstraction with explicit content types and constructors for text, JSON, and form data.
  * Expanded FormData with rich parsing, serialization, iteration, conversion, and mutation APIs.

* **Refactor**
  * Reorganized request body surface: body types moved under req::body and FormData into req::body::form_data (path changes may be breaking).

* **Documentation**
  * Examples updated to use new module paths.

* **Tests**
  * Updated imports to new paths and removed an unused test import.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Refactor `HttpRequest` to use `RequestData` for improved data handlin…
body:
…g. Updated methods `get_all_data` and `get_data` to return `RequestData` and adjusted related tests for consistency.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Introduced a byte-friendly request data container with readable display, iteration, and memory-size reporting.

- Breaking Changes
  - Request data type changed; public data accessor now returns the new container.
  - get_data now returns an owned String instead of a borrowed reference.

- Performance
  - More efficient storage with fewer allocations, optional zero-copy paths, and shrink-to-fit support.

- Documentation
  - Examples updated to use human-readable printing.

- Tests
  - Expectations adjusted for owned String return values.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Fix/refactor
body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Structured form-data support with builders, iteration, conversions, and URL encode/decode helpers (query-string rendering/parsing).
  - Request bodies and helpers now use and expose the structured form-data and a method to access all parameters; body types expose MIME type strings.

- **Chores**
  - Internal error logging redirected to stdout.
  - Added an external URL-encoding dependency.

- **Tests**
  - Added and updated tests covering form-data behavior, encoding/decoding, and related request handling.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Feat/docs
body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

- New Features

  - Supports parsing from and generating URL-encoded query strings for round‑trips.
  - Exposed a request body module in the request API surface.

- Tests

title: Refactor request handling and error management: Update async function…

…s in `test.sh` to ignore request parameters, introduce `ApiError` for better error handling in `api_error.rs`, and restructure request body handling in `request_body.rs`. Clean up imports and enhance type definitions in `types.rs` and `mod.rs` for improved clarity and organization.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

  - Middleware interface renamed to MiddlewareTrait; update implementations and type usages.
  - Error handling consolidated into a dedicated ApiError module; behavior unchanged.

- Documentation

- Tests

title: Enhance documentation for `RouteParams`, `ResponseHeaders`, and `Stat…
body:
…usCode`: Expand examples and clarify usage for type-safe parameter handling, HTTP response headers, and status codes. Include detailed explanations of methods, parameters, and expected behaviors to improve user understanding and usability.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Response headers are now case-insensitive and offer a fluent builder-style API with shortcuts for content type, CORS, and security headers.
  - Route parameters gain convenient accessors and a helper to extract multiple typed parameters in one call.
  - Status codes add category-check helpers and a canonical-reason accessor; 301/302 display text updated.

- Documentation
  - Added a comprehensive guide to response status codes covering usage, conversions, categories, examples, and compatibility.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Feat/docs

title: Feat/docs
body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Documentation**
  * Improved clarity and consistency in async usage and error handling across documentation examples.
  * Expanded the Features section with more detailed framework capabilities.
  * Updated installation instructions to include required dependencies.
  * Corrected and modernized example code to reflect current API and usage patterns.
  * Enhanced example responses and cleaned up outdated explanations.
  * Unified example style by embedding runnable async server setups.
  * Updated middleware usage examples to reflect new signatures and control flow.
  * Revised router registration and import paths in examples.
* **New Features**
  * Added support for HTTP OPTIONS method routing.
* **Bug Fixes**
  * Corrected response texts in example POST handlers.
  * Fixed route parameter syntax and access methods in examples.
  * Updated cookie retrieval to return optional values instead of errors.
* **Refactor**
  * Updated middleware interface to take ownership of request objects.
  * Unified example code to use full async runtime setup with consistent patterns.
  * Refactored CORS and logger middleware to use shared handler middleware types and updated signatures.
  * Simplified cookie handling and updated tests to align with new optional cookie return type.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Feat/hyper
body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Migrated the server framework from Actix to Hyper and Routerify, enhancing routing, middleware, and static file serving.
  * Introduced a redesigned middleware system with simplified interfaces, including updated CORS and logger middleware variants.
  * Added support for OPTIONS HTTP method and empty request/response bodies.
  * Improved static file serving with URI rewriting, conditional GET, and caching support.
  * Added helper utilities for middleware execution and query parameter serialization.

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Enhanced cookie parsing and header management in request and response handling.

* **Refactor**
  * Refactored middleware and handler interfaces to use references and return optional responses for greater flexibility.
  * Updated request and response types to replace Actix dependencies with Hyper and Cookie crates.
  * Simplified and adapted test cases to align with the new middleware and request/response APIs.

* **Tests**
  * Commented out CORS middleware tests pending further updates.
  * Adjusted logger middleware tests to new invocation style.

* **Style**
  * Reformatted TypeScript test code for improved readability and consistency.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Feat/docs
body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Introduced a type-safe enum for HTTP status codes and a dedicated struct for managing response headers, offering fluent methods for common headers, CORS, and security settings.
  * Added convenience methods to set standard HTTP response statuses and headers.

* **Refactor**
  * Replaced raw status codes and header maps with structured types for improved clarity and safety.
  * Updated method names and references to reflect new struct and enum usage.

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Improved case-insensitive header handling and support for multiple header values.

* **Documentation**
  * Enhanced module and struct documentation for improved clarity.

* **Tests**
  * Added comprehensive tests for response headers and updated existing tests to use new status code and header types.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
